abstract: Shell is confident it will get final approval from regulators to begin drilling for oil off the Alaskan coast this year, despite embarrassing delays and equipment problems.
snippet: Shell is confident it will get final approval from regulators to begin drilling for oil off the Alaskan coast this year, despite embarrassing delays and equipment problems.
lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Despite embarrassing delays and trouble with its equipment, Shell remains confident that it will get final approval from regulators and be able to begin drilling for oil in Arctic waters off the Alaskan coast this summer, the oil company’s top Alaska executive said on Friday.

headline.main: Arctic Drilling Will Begin This Year, Shell Official Says
headline.print_headline: Arctic Drilling Will Begin This Year, Shell Official Says
